alert.note: Alert for Clinton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 11:13PM EDT until April 01 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM EDT FOR NORTHERN MADISON...NORTHWESTERN DELAWARE...EASTERN CLINTON... HOWARD...NORTHEASTERN BOONE...NORTHERN HAMILTON AND TIPTON COUNTIES... At 1113 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles southwest of Walton to 10 miles northeast of Frankfort to 7 miles northeast of Lebanon, and are nearly stationary. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Noblesville, Tipton, Cicero, Sheridan, Arcadia, Russiaville, Kirklin, Atlanta, Kempton and Morse Reservoir around 1113 PM EDT. This includes Interstate 69 between mile markers 241 and 252. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for central and east central Indiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
